intro_text: p_l takes the patrol down to the beach to train, but the patrol pauses when they encounter something odd.
decline_text: It's best to go back to camp and ignore the oddities on the beach.

success_outcomes.text: r_c explains that the sea has always given mysterious gifts to c_n and that those strange ginger cat statues are probably just another gift from the ocean... Probably.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat speculated about the origin of a mysterious ginger cat statue on the beach.

success_outcomes.text: The strange ginger cat statues seem to be purring slightly. r_c suggests they leave the beach as soon as possible; those things don't seem... entirely of this world.

log.cats_from: from_cat and to_cat speculated about the origin of a mysterious ginger cat statue on the beach.

success_outcomes.text: s_c laughs! The ginger cat statues are Twoleg objects; {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/spin/spins} a tale almost unbelievable, but {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/swear/swears} it's true! The ginger cat statues used to live on something called a "boat."

log.cats_from: from_cat was very impressed that to_cat knew the origin of the mysterious ginger cat statue on the beach.

success_outcomes.text: Those ginger cat statues? s_c heard a kittypet call him Garfield. s_c explains that, for whatever reason, Twolegs worship the ginger cat so much that they made statues they throw into the ocean.

log.cats_from: from_cat was very impressed that to_cat knew the origin of the mysterious ginger cat statue on the beach.

fail_outcomes.text: There is no way r_c is staying around here. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/tear/tears} off back to camp at the sight of a broken ginger cat statue.

log.cats_from: from_cat wasn't impressed that to_cat got so freaked out by a ginger cat statue {PRONOUN/to_cat/subject} ran back to camp and spoiled a training patrol.

fail_outcomes.text: The whole patrol agrees this beach is abandoned by StarClan. There's no way so many broken ginger cat statues are here naturally, and well, s_c has always been a little odd...

log.cats_from: from_cat speculated that to_cat had something to do with the strange ginger cat statues washing up on the beach.

intro_text: p_l decides to go down to the beach by {PRONOUN/p_l/self}. There seems to be something strange here...
decline_text: It's best to go back to camp and ignore the oddities on the beach.

success_outcomes.text: p_l is shocked to find green and black lizards scattered around the beach. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/freeze/freezes}, trying not to get bit. When nothing moves, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/head/heads} back to camp unscathed.

Green and black lizards are everywhere! p_l freezes up, only to notice that they're not moving and some of them stick straight up. They're not real! {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP} {VERB/p_l/take/takes} a fake lizard home to show the others.
There are green and black lizards! s_c realizes they're not real immediately and decides to come back to this location to collect fake lizards for future pranks on Clanmates.

log.cats_from: from_cat fell victim to to_cat's fake lizard prank.

success_outcomes.text: s_c remembers seeing these green and black lizards being shown to {PRONOUN/s_c/object} by a kittypet before, who called them "lego dragons." s_c wonders if Legodragon would be a proper name for a warrior.

log.cats_from: from_cat heard to_cat contemplate naming a kit Legokit and thought it was a ridiculous name.

fail_outcomes.text: It's a beach full of lizards! p_l tears back to camp before {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} can get bitten.

intro_text: The large patrol practices holding another cat's head above the water, using the calm (but very chilly) waters of a rockpool. app1 shivers, despite being huddled with p_l. Why couldn't {PRONOUN/app1/subject} practice this on a hot sunny day?
decline_text: Taking a break turns into ending the patrol early.

success_outcomes.text: s_c sits on the windward side of app1, trying to give {PRONOUN/app1/object} a little more shelter. It's understandable, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/sympathize/sympathizes}, but app1 can't rely on cats in distress only showing up when the sea is inviting. The sympathy (and a little physical warmth) puts cheer back into app1, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/take/takes} {PRONOUN/app1/poss} next turn at lifeguarding practice with enthusiasm.

log.cats_from: to_cat both cheered and warmed from_cat up on a training patrol during a lesson about rescuing other cats from the water.
from_cat and to_cat practiced rescuing cats from the water.

success_outcomes.text: s_c nods. Lifeguarding isn't easy, even in practice. But {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/offer/offers} up the story of a kitten saved by a c_n warrior who had the strength and will to keep the little ball of fur above the waves under nearly impossible circumstances. It makes app1 sit up straight, proud to be carrying on that tradition.

log.cats_from: from_cat listened intently to to_cat's story of how a c_n warrior rescued a kitten from the water.
from_cat and to_cat practiced rescuing cats from the water.

success_outcomes.text: Doesn't app1 want to be an ocean dancer, one of the many cats in c_n's ancestry who managed to master the waves, streaking in and out to save lives that have been lost to the ocean's jaws, s_c asks? And well, when {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/put/puts} it like that... app1's motivation returns.

log.cats_from: from_cat was convinced of the importance of learning to rescue cats from the water by to_cat's stories of ocean dancers.
from_cat and to_cat practiced rescuing cats from the water.

fail_outcomes.text: Learning the art of water rescue is important, of course, but safety comes first. app1 has {PRONOUN/app1/poss} pelt licked dry and warm again, and the patrol is called off early.

log.cats_from: from_cat appreciated that to_cat was willing to cut a training session short to warm {PRONOUN/from_cat/object} up.

fail_outcomes.text: app1 is right - this is far, far too cold of a pool to train in, and {PRONOUN/app1/subject}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} shivering too badly to continue. Time to go home. p_l apologizes for bringing the patrol out here.

log.cats_from: from_cat thought to_cat's choice of freezing cold water for lifeguarding training was at fault for app1's shivering.

history_text.scar: m_c was scarred from the bite of the cold rock pool {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} swam in as an apprentice.
history_text.death: Falling into a cold rock pool gave m_c problems that eventually resulted in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} death.
